(Green and Yellow)'' | Badge = | Badge_size = 140px | Badge_size = 130px | FIFA Trigramme = BRA | FIFA Rank = 2 [http://www.futsalworldranking.be/rank.htm Futsal World Ranking] | FIFA max = 1 | FIFA max date = 22 January 1996 | FIFA min = | FIFA min date = | Elo Rank = | Elo max = | Elo max date = | Elo min = | Elo min date = | Elo rating max = | Elo rating max date = | Association = [[ConfederaÃ§Ã£o Brasileira de Futebol de SalÃ£o]] (Brazilian Futsal Confederation) | Confederation = [[CONMEBOL]] ([[South AmÃ©ria]]) | Coach = [[Marcos AurÃ©lio Sorato|Marcos Sorato]] "Pipoca" | Asst Manager = [[Vander Iacovino]] | Captain = [[VinÃ­cius Elias Teixeira|VinÃ­cius]] | Most caps = | Top scorer = [[Alessandro Rosa Vieira|FalcÃ£o]] (299) | Home Stadium = Various | pattern_la1 = _bra10h | pattern_b1 = _bra10h | pattern_ra1 = _bra10h | pattern_so1 = _bra10h | leftarm1 = FFDF00 | body1 = FFDF00 | rightarm1 = FFDF00 | shorts1 = 0000BF | socks1 = FFFFFF | pattern_la2 = _bra10a | pattern_b2 = _bra10a | pattern_ra2 = _bra10a | pattern_so2 = _bra10a | leftarm2 = 0000FF | body2 = 0000FF | rightarm2 = 0000FF | shorts2 = FFFFFF | socks2 = 0000BF | First game = | Largest win = {{Flagicon|Brazil}} Brazil [[Brazil 76-0 Timor-Leste (futsal)|76â0]] [[East Timor national futsal team|East Timor]] {{flagicon| East Timor}}

(World Record international score) | Largest loss = {{Flagicon|Brazil}} Brazil 1â6 [[Netherlands national futsal team|Netherlands]] {{flagicon|NED}}
([[Genk]], [[Belgium]]; 23 May 1995) | World cup apps = 6 ''(All)'' | World cup first = 1989 | World cup best = [[File:Med 1.png|10px]] Champions, 4 times | Regional name = [[South American Futsal Championship]] | Regional cup apps = 20 ''(All)'' | Regional cup first = [[1964 South American Futsal Championship|1964]] | Regional cup best = [[File:Med 1.png|10px]] Champions, 18 times }} The '''Brazil national futsal team''' represents Brazil during international [[futsal]] competitions. It is under the direction of the [[Brazilian Futsal Confederation]] or ConfederaÃ§Ã£o Brasileira de Futebol de SalÃ£o. The team is considered to be the strongest in the world earning a record three straight championships in the [[FIFA Futsal World Cup]]. Brazil also holds a record twelve championship wins in the [[South American Futsal Championship]] also known as the Copa America â FIFA Futsal and five wins in the [[South American Futsal Championship|TaÃ§a AmÃ©rica de Futsal]]. As of December 2010 Brazil is ranked second in the [http://www.futsalworldranking.be/ Futsal World Ranking]. Brazil has played in all FIFA Futsal World cups and has finished in the top three places in all six tournaments. * '''The past''' Ever since the early days of the FIFA Futsal World Cup, Brazil have been a force to be reckoned with on the international scene. The Auriverde claimed the trophy at the first three editions of the showpiece event, at Netherlands 1989, Hong Kong 1992 and Spain 1996, but have since been outstripped by their futsal bÃªte noire, Spain. La Furia Roja proved too strong for Brazil in the Final of Guatemala 2000 and at the semi-final stage of Chinese Taipei 2004, where they went on to take the title once more. They are known for defeating East Timor 76â0 in the Lusophony Games in Macau. * '''The present''' Since Brazil were awarded host nation status for the FIFA Futsal World Cup 2008, retaking their place at the summit of the world game has become a matter of national pride. Coach Paulo Cesar de Oliveira has been charged with finding the right mix of players from Brazil's stellar domestic league â such as FalcÃ£o, player of the tournament at Chinese Taipei â and those working wonders in Spanish and Italian futsal. Having qualified automatically for Brazil 2008, the Auriverde's star-studded squad must now prove they have the will to win to match their undoubted talent. * '''The future''' Missing out on the futsal world title for the second tournament in succession in 2004 was a crushing blow to all those involved with the Brazilian national team. The task now facing the coaching staff is to imbue the Canarinha squad with the belief that they can indeed knock Spain off their perch. "We need to rebuild our players' confidence. The FIFA Futsal World Cup is the culmination of a long-term project, during which we hope that every player called up to the SeleÃ§Ã£o realises the level of effort and tactical awareness needed, over and above individual talent, to achieve success," underlined head coach "PC" de Oliveira. ==Current squad== Head coach: {{flagicon|BRA}} [[Marcos Sorato]] The following 15 players were named for 2010 Grand Prix de Futsal {{nat fs start}} {{nat fs player|no=1|pos=GK|name=[[Alcides Pereira da Silva|CidÃ£o]]|age=10 September 1980 (aged 30)|caps= |club={{flagicon|Spain}} [[Caja Segovia FS]]}} {{nat fs player|no=2|pos=GK|name=[[Tiago de Melo Marinho|Tiago]]|age=9 March 1981 (aged 29)|caps= |club={{flagicon|Brazil}} [[Malwee/JaraguÃ¡|Malwee Futsal]]}} {{nat fs player|no=3|pos=GK|name=[[Franklin Roosevelt Bueres Junior|Franklin]]|age=18 May 1971 (aged 39)|caps= |club={{flagicon|Brazil}} [[Joinville Esporte Clube|Krona Futsal]]}} {{nat fs player|no=4|pos=MF|name=[[Ari Santos|Ari]]|age=6 March 1982 (aged 28)|caps= |club={{flagicon|Spain}} [[FC Barcelona]]}} {{nat fs player|no=5|pos=DF|name=[[Jefferson Brito|CiÃ§o]]|age=16 October 1981 (aged 29)|caps= |club={{flagicon|Iran}} [[Foolad Mahan FSC]]}} {{nat fs player|no=6|pos=MF|name=[[Gabriel da Silva Dias|Gabriel]]|age=17 November 1980 (aged 29)|caps= |club={{flagicon|Spain}} [[InterviÃº FS|Inter Movistar]]}} {{nat fs player|no=7|pos=MF|name=[[VinÃ­cius Elias Teixeira|VinÃ­cius]]|age=31 December 1977 (aged 32)|caps= |club={{flagicon|Spain}} [[ElPozo Murcia FS|ElPozo Murcia]]}} {{nat fs player|no=8|pos=MF|name=[[Luis Fernando Coelho Saydel|Xuxa]]|age=16 April 1986 (aged 24)|caps= |club={{flagicon|Russia}} [[MFK Tyumen]]}} {{nat fs player|no=9|pos=FW|name=[[Fernando Nascimento Cosme|Fernandinho]]|age=1 July 1983 (aged 27)|caps= |club={{flagicon|Russia}} [[MFK Dinamo Moskva]]}} {{nat fs player|no=10|pos=FW|name=[[CÃ©sar Paulo Lopes Cardoso Campos|CÃ©sar Paulo]]|age=15 January 1979 (aged 31)|caps= |club={{flagicon|Portugal}} [[S.L.
